biography.heading: Biography
biography.content: Erik Gunnar Asplund was a Swedish architect, mostly known for his contributions to Nordic Classicism as well as functionalism or 'Swedish Grace'. His work combined classical and modernist influences and had a significant impact on architecture in the Nordic countries.

career.heading: Career
career.content: Asplund's career spanned the early 20th century, during which he created numerous influential buildings and city plans. His most famous works include the Stockholm Public Library and the Woodland Cemetery (Skogskyrkog√•rden) in Stockholm.

legacy.heading: Legacy
legacy.content: Asplund's architectural legacy continues to influence modern design. His ability to blend traditional and modern elements created a unique architectural language that remains relevant today.
